answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!You have probably severe sinusitis. This is causing post nasal drip, bad taste in mouth, and tongue swelling. This chronic infection can be due to diabetes which can also cause facial coolness. The coolness can also be due to other neuropathies and environmental factors.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

Had 3 rounds of antibiotics last fall/early winter for sinusitis first then probable diverticulitis.   In Jan. I had all sorts of blood work done, only thing unusual was positive ANA titer (1:320), rheumatologist ordered lots more tests - nothing abnormal.   Glucose normal so no diabetes.  Just a number of strange symptoms driving me crazy.   Have appt. with Dr. next wk. to tie up loose ends from visits with several specialists who aren't finding much!

question: For couple of mos. have had postnasal drip, tongue feels swollen, bad taste in mouth & most annoying is the feeling of coolness of face (mostly eyes & cheek areas).   The cool sensation is driving me crazy.Any thoughts.
